description.narrative: At least 60% of children in provinces of geographical focus area are fed according to the guidelines on infant and young children feeding practices, 60% of children under 5 sleep under LLITNs, 60% of parents are able to recognize signs of danger and adopt key practices on the treatment of diarrhea with OSR and zinc and 60% of pregnant women use the PMTCT services in health structures by 2018

sector.narrative: Advocacy and partnership-building for social behaviour change
Birth Registration/Civil Registration and Vital Statistics systems
Capacity and skills development for social behaviour change
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
Research, monitoring and evaluation and knowledge management for C4D
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Strengthening C4D in Government systems including preparedness for humanitarian action
Technical assistance - Cross-sectoral communication for development

description.narrative: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities social services (incl youth development and women+ children)

title.narrative: Burundi United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Burundi Country Programme Document 2010-2014 Results Matrix
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Burundi 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Burundi Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: At least 60% of children in provinces of geographical focus area are fed according to the guidelines on infant and young children feeding practices, 60% of children under 5 sleep under LLITNs, 60% of parents are able to recognize signs of danger and adopt key practices on the treatment of diarrhea with OSR and zinc and 60% of pregnant women use the PMTCT services in health structures by 2018

description.narrative: Promotion of key family practices reached 903,300 people exceeding the planned target of 800,000. Behaviour and social change communication contributed to adoption of positive nutrition behaviours such as infant and young child feeding practices in targeted provinces. Communication and community engagement interventions were implemented for Ebola preparedness and malaria prevention. | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:31/12/2018

title.narrative: # of community members reached through social mobilisation on health and nutrition
# of functional listening groups on key family practices in health and nutrition, IYCF and immunization at community level
